programme.title: The Vietnam War
programme.desc: In Vietnam, the South faces a backlash from the North, and U.S. veterans face dishonor and neglect back home.

programme.title: Vietnam: The War that Made Australia
programme.desc: Australia sends a unit of soldiers to train the South Vietnamese army to fight communists in the early 1960s.

programme.title: Vietnam: The War that Made Australia
programme.desc: Australia's Team veterans and their South Vietnamese colleagues describe their parts in the height of the war.

programme.title: Vietnam: The War that Made Australia
programme.desc: The Team must leave behind the Vietnamese with whom they've fought for almost ten years, despite their bonds.

programme.title: Beyond the Beach: The Hell and the Hope
programme.desc: Medical workers confront violence in Afghanistan before Kabul's evacuation and a tragic humanitarian crisis.

programme.title: Naachtun: The Forgotten Mayan City
programme.desc: Maya developed a wealthy, regal civilization, then mysteriously disappeared. Researchers search for reasons.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Natives, Spanish missions, and more shaped L.A.’s growth, leading to its identity as the home of Hollywood.

programme.title: Empire Builders: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Many diverse forces shaped L.A., bringing cultural richness and tensions, and making it a global arts hub.

programme.title: The Underground Army
programme.desc: Germany's historic invasion of Poland in WWII led to the creation of the anti-Nazi Polish Underground State.

programme.title: The Underground Army
programme.desc: Among other resistance feats, the Polish Underground State created a positive symbol in the Anchor of Hope.

programme.title: The Underground Army
programme.desc: During WWII, the Underground State issued sentences against German officers and carried out their executions.

programme.title: The Underground Army
programme.desc: The Warsaw Uprising erupted in Poland's biggest city. Stalin occupied Eastern Europe, and the Poles fought on.

programme.title: Hitler's 9/11: The Secret War on America
programme.desc: Hitler's most daring war plans involved German fighter planes crashing into Manhattan skyscrapers.

programme.title: Undermining the Nazis: Paris' Secret Tunnels
programme.desc: Two men show extraordinary courage by secretly mapping Paris' underground during the 1940 German occupation.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.sub-title: The Nazi Camps - An Architecture of Murder
programme.desc: This documentary explain how a system so quickly became the rationalized apparatus of genocide.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The race for new discoveries led an institution to carry out countless acts of barbarism.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.sub-title: The Banker Of The Third Reich

programme.title: Medal of Honor: Exceptional Valor
programme.desc: The Medal of Honor's requirements and meaning shifted before WWI; actions needed to be exceptional.

programme.desc: The U.S. held forces in the Philippines in their easternmost base, just 1,800 miles from Tokyo.

programme.title: Medal of Honor: Exceptional Valor

programme.desc: When Iraq invaded Kuwait in 1990, the world reacted with condemnation. Operation Desert Storm was launched.

programme.sub-title: Suez: The Line in the Sand
